alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 5:49PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the Brooks Range in the Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...Through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...River levels will continue to rise through Monday. Flows in rivers may increase quickly covering gravel bars. An increased amount of debris will flow down rivers. Flooding in low-lying areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt has caused rivers draining from the southeastern Brooks Range to rise to near bankfull in many locations, with water over banks in some low lying areas. A Flood Warning has been issued for the Koyukuk River at Allakaket and a Flood Advisory has been issued for the Koyukuk River downstream of Allakaket to Hughes. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are encouraged to monitor river levels this weekend.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
